extendedIngredients.name: brown sugar
extendedIngredients.original: 3 Tbs. firmly packed dark brown sugar

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste

title: Roasted Baby Beets With Balsamic, Orange And Mint
summary: Roasted Baby Beets With Balsamic, Orange And Mint might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. This recipe makes 75 servings with 18 calories, 0g of protein, and 1g of fat each. For 6 cents per serving, this recipe covers 1% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have slivered mint, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. With a spoonacular score of 14%, this dish is rather bad. Try Roasted Baby Beets and Blood Orange Salad with Blue Cheese, Roasted Baby Carrots, with Chile, Mint and Orange Glaze, and Roasted Baby Carrots, With Chile, Mint And Orange Glaze for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat an oven to 400F.Thoroughly wash the beets and pat dry with paper towels. Place in a roasting pan, add the olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and toss the beets to coat. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake until the beets are tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Transfer the pan to a wire rack and let the beets cool to room temperature. Slip off the skins and quarter the beets lengthwise.Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the vinegar and brown sugar and bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Cook until the sauce is slightly thickened, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool.Just before serving, in a large bowl, combine the beets, balsamic sauce, half of the mint, salt and pepper, and toss to combine. Transfer to a serving platter. Using a citrus zester, zest strips of orange directly over the beets so they will absorb the flavorful oil from the zest. Garnish with the remaining mint. Serve immediately.

steps.step: Preheat an oven to 400F.Thoroughly wash the beets and pat dry with paper towels.

Place in a roasting pan, add the olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and toss the beets to coat. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake until the beets are tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour.

Transfer the pan to a wire rack and let the beets cool to room temperature. Slip off the skins and quarter the beets lengthwise.Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the vinegar and brown sugar and bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Cook until the sauce is slightly thickened, 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let cool.Just before serving, in a large bowl, combine the beets, balsamic sauce, half of the mint, salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
Transfer to a serving platter. Using a citrus zester, zest strips of orange directly over the beets so they will absorb the flavorful oil from the zest.
